·        An increase in the Alternative Minimum Tax exemption so that it only hits families earning $1 million or more, a tax cut of $572 billion between 2018 and 2025. #VA10

·        A 20% deduction for pass-through businesses, which are largely small businesses.

·        An $11 million death tax exemption. If allowed to sunset, the exemption would revert back to $5.49 million.

·        The reduction of nearly every income tax bracket, a tax cut of $1.2 trillion between 2018 and 2025.

·        A $2,000 Child Tax Credit (CTC). If allowed to sunset, the CTC would revert to $1,000 per child.

·        A $12,000 standard deduction for an individual, or a $24,000 standard deduction for a family. If allowed to sunset, the standard deduction would revert to $6,000 for individuals or $12,000 for a family.

Having an updated report will also allow companies in Indiana & across the country to have a better understanding on how they can anticipate the needs of the federal government & provide the best quality product for American consumers.

Some of the nation’s largest vehicle fleets recycle used oil for re-refining & procure re-refined oil, including the Department of Defense, U.S. Postal Service, National Park Service, & state & local authorities.

Americans daily operate motor vehicles that rely on lubricated oil to run safely & efficiently. Our country is already re-refining lubricated oil through a process which rids the oil of harmful contaminants & restores the oil to its original effectiveness.

✅PASSES SENATE: I'm proud my #bipartisan re-refining bill is on its way to be signed into law. We need an up-to-date report from the DoE that'll allow Congress to better develop energy saving & environmentally conscious policy in connection w/how we use & reuse lubricating oil.

☑️ PASSES HOUSE: #PAHPA (H.R.6378) is a #bipartisan effort to ensure our nation is prepared for & can respond to #publichealth threats & emergencies quickly & efficiently so we can keep Americans safe. LEARN MORE >> https://t.co/rqBZe6n3g2 https://t.co/3Qdvukwf8W
I'd like to thank my colleagues @RepAnnaEshoo, @repgregwalden & @FrankPallone for their work & attention on #PAHPA to ensure we are able to keep Americans safe during #publichealth emergencies.

I am proud #PAHPA reflects extensive feedback from the full range of medical & public health preparedness & response stakeholders in order to best examine our response as a nation to threats & to ensure we have clear procedures, resources & support in place to keep Americans safe

Importantly, #PAHPA establishes new advisory groups focused on protecting vulnerable populations such as senior citizens & people w/disabilities during #publichealth threats & emergencies. It also reauthorizes the advisory committee focusing on the specific needs of children.

#PAHPA is a #bipartisan bill that ensures our #healthcare professionals are trained to respond to possible pandemic outbreaks. It prioritizes the further development of our national stockpile of vaccines, basic medical equipment like gloves, hazmat suits & masks, & diagnostics.

In 2001 anthrax attacks infected 17+ people & ended 5 people’s lives. Since then, the threat of a chemical, biological, radiological or nuclear incident has not dissipated, but instead continues to grow. Our adversaries are continuously looking for ways to produce threats.

✅PASSES HOUSE: I'm proud to have led the #bipartisan reauthorization of #PAHPA in the House. This bill ensures we're prepared to respond to #publichealth emergencies resulting from chemical, biological, radiological or nuclear attacks, natural disasters or infectious diseases.

Read this op-ed in the @indystar for more information on the many ways the Law Enforcement #MentalHealth & Wellness Act (now law) helps our heroes in law enforcement protect their own emotional & mental well-being >> https://t.co/SqkAvJWU4i

Ensuring the safety of the law enforcement community across the US is critically important. This law also directs @DeptofDefense & @DeptVetAffairs to share best practices used by the military to help soldiers w/PTSD &other #mentalhealth challenges w/local law enforcement agencies

The Law Enforcement Mental Health & Wellness Act:
✅makes grants available to initiate peer mentoring pilot programs
✅develops training for #mentalhealth providers specific to law enforcement mental health needs
✅studies effectiveness of hotlines & annual mental health checks

We place so much emphasis & attention on our officers’ physical fitness, but we need to do more to ensure they are mentally healthy as well. I'm proud a bill I intro'd in the House, H.R. 2228, the Law Enforcement #MentalHealth & Wellness Act, was signed into law this year.

This bill makes it easier for #veterans to use the opportunities that licensing, certification & national tests provide to advance & enhance their education, & to build a career. To learn more about the #VeteransTESTAct, click here >> https://t.co/QqqTAM8eHH

The Veterans TEST Accessibility Act ensures our #veterans are prepared for a wide variety of career paths upon returning home from deployment by making it easier to enhance their education, build a career & provide a better life not only for themselves but for their families.

The Veterans TEST Accessibility Act provides our #veterans simpler, fairer access to tests, like the SAT & certifications, like certifications for mechanics, firefighters & realtors, so they can compete in today’s job market after serving our country

Veterans should always have access to the education benefits they've earned. I introduced the #VeteransTESTAct, which was signed into law as part of the #ForeverGIBill, giving #veterans simpler & fairer access to tests & certifications so they can compete in today’s job market.

🇺🇸 One Year Ago Today: The #ForeverGIBill was signed into law. 
There are over a half million #veterans in Indiana. They must be properly compensated & cared for, & that includes guaranteeing access to important benefits & services that support assimilation into civilian life.

"Brooks releases #bipartisan reauthorization bill to protect U.S. from public health threats" >> https://t.co/bxAmx0Vzuj

I'd like to thank @RepAnnaEshoo & my colleagues at @HouseCommerce for their attention to this issue. I cannot emphasize enough how critically important it is to reauthorize #PAHPA before it expires at the end of September.

#PAHPA ensures more #heathcare professionals like nurses/doctors can be hired/trained when facing a #publichealth crisis. It ensures we have a robust supply of vaccines, equipment like gloves, hazmat suits, masks etc in our Strategic National Stockpiles located across the country

To ensure we're better prepared when facing an outbreak like Zika or Ebola, #PAHPA improves the existing Emergency Response Fund so the Secretary doesn't have to wait on approval from Congress to immediately fund the response measures needed to counteract an outbreak & save lives
Our bill reflects extensive feedback from the full range of medical & public health preparedness and response stakeholders. You can see the list here >> https://t.co/xa9lJZSU32

This bipartisan #publichealth & #nationalsecurity effort will ensure our nation is better prepared to respond to natural disasters, emerging infectious diseases, & chemical, biological, radiological or nuclear attacks whether from terrorist groups or from nation states.

✅ TO THE HOUSE FLOOR: @HouseCommerce voted to send our nation's most important #publichealth emergency preparedness & response tool to the House floor for consideration by the full House of Representatives. My remarks explaining #PAHPA's importance >> https://t.co/VM42c7g1fM https://t.co/iiIxvhs4PE

🎥 TUNE IN: It’s critically important to ensure our country is prepared to respond to all #publichealth emergencies. It’s our job as Members of Congress keep Americans safe & secure & #PAHPA, the bill we are considering today, is an essential component of accomplishing that goal. https://t.co/jOKR5lBuyI
